    • Constructor Detail

      • Dataframe

        public Dataframe(java.lang.String path,
                 java.lang.String separateur)
        Creates a Dataframe instance from a .csv file.

        The first row of csvFileName should contain the names of the columns. The second row of csvFileName should contain the types of the columns. The type of a column can only be one of the following: "int", "double", "bool", or "string". The remaining rows in csvFileName should contain the values of each of the columns.

        Parameters:
        path - is an absolute path to a ".csv" file
        separateur - is a String representing the cell separator of the .csv file
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the .csv file does not contain at least the column name(s) and their type(s), or if an invalid type is specified, or if a column name is specified more than once

      • Dataframe

        public Dataframe(java.lang.String[][] data)
          throws java.lang.Exception
        Creates a Dataframe instance from a 2-dimensional String array.

        The first row of argument data should contain the names of the columns. The second row of argument data should contain the types of the columns. The type of a column can only be one of the following: "int", "double", "bool", or "string". The rest of the rows in data should contain the values of each of the columns.

        Parameters:
        data - a 2-dimensional array of Strings from which a Dataframe instance is created
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if data does not contain at least the column name(s) and their type(s), or if an invalid type is specified, or if a column name is specified more than once

      • showHead

        public void showHead(int n)
        Description copied from interface: interfaces.Dataframe_itf
        Displays the first n rows of elements, if any, in the dataframe
        Specified by:
        showHead in interface interfaces.Dataframe_itf
        Parameters:
        n - an integer, representing the first n rows of elements in the Dataframe to display. If n is less than 0, n is set to the default value of 5.
        See Also:
        Dataframe_itf

        Specified by:

        See Also:

      • selectRow

        public Dataframe selectRow(int idx)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: interfaces.Dataframe_itf
        Returns a Dataframe object of the elements at row idx.

        Dataframe rows follow a zero-based numbering. The returned Dataframe object has the same definition as the original Dataframe.

        Specified by:
        selectRow in interface interfaces.Dataframe_itf
        Parameters:
        idx - the row index to select from the Dataframe
        Returns:
        a Dataframe that contains the row selected from the current Dataframe
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if argument idx is not between zero (inclusive) and the number of rows in the Dataframe (exclusive).
        See Also:
        Dataframe_itf

      • selectRows

        public Dataframe selectRows(int[] idx)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: interfaces.Dataframe_itf
        Returns a Dataframe object from this Dataframe of the elements at the rows in argument idx.

        Dataframe rows follow a zero-based numbering. The returned Dataframe object has the same definition as the original Dataframe.

        Specified by:
        selectRows in interface interfaces.Dataframe_itf
        Parameters:
        idx - an integer array, containing the row indexes to select from the Dataframe
        Returns:
        a Dataframe that contains the rows selected from the current Dataframe
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if any value in idx is not between zero (inclusive) and the number of rows in the Dataframe (exclusive).
        See Also:
        Dataframe_itf

      • selectColumn

        public Dataframe selectColumn(java.lang.String column)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: interfaces.Dataframe_itf
        Returns a Dataframe object from this Dataframe of the elements in the column name passed as argument. The returned Dataframe object has the same definition as the original column in the original Dataframe.
        Specified by:
        selectColumn in interface interfaces.Dataframe_itf
        Parameters:
        column - a String, representing the name of the column in the Dataframe to select from
        Returns:
        a Dataframe that contains all the elements in the specified column
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if there is no column in the Dataframe with the name passed as argument.
        See Also:
        Dataframe_itf

      • selectColumns

        public Dataframe selectColumns(java.lang.String[] columns)
                        throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: interfaces.Dataframe_itf
        Returns a Dataframe object from this Dataframe of the elements in the columns name passed as argument. The columns in the returned Dataframe object have the same definition as the original columns in the original Dataframe.
        Specified by:
        selectColumns in interface interfaces.Dataframe_itf
        Parameters:
        columns - a String array, representing the name of the columns in the Dataframe to select from
        Returns:
        a Dataframe that contains all the elements in the specified columns
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if there is any element in argument columns that is not the name of a column in the Dataframe.
        See Also:
        Dataframe_itf

      • min

        public java.lang.Double[] min(java.lang.String[] columns)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: interfaces.Dataframe_itf
        Returns a Double array where each index contains either null or the minimum value of a column in columns.

        There is an implicit mapping of the values in the returned array to the columns in the columns argument, using the array indexes.

        Specified by:
        min in interface interfaces.Dataframe_itf
        Parameters:
        columns - a String array of column names in the Dataframe
        Returns:
        an array of Doubles with same dimension as columns, containing the minimum value in each column of argument columns
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if there is any element in argument columns that is not the name of a column in the Dataframe.
        See Also:
        Dataframe_itf

      • max

        public java.lang.Double[] max(java.lang.String[] columns)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: interfaces.Dataframe_itf
        Returns a Double array where each index contains either null or the maximum value of a column in columns.

        There is an implicit mapping of the values in the returned array to the columns in the columns argument, using the array indexes.

        Specified by:
        max in interface interfaces.Dataframe_itf
        Parameters:
        columns - a String array of column names in the Dataframe
        Returns:
        an array of Doubles with same dimension as columns, containing the maximum value in each column of argument columns
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if there is any element in argument columns that is not the name of a column in the Dataframe.
        See Also:
        Dataframe_itf
